sn22.114:1.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn22.114:1.3: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘knowledge’.
sn22.114:1.5: And how is a knowledgeable person defined?”
sn22.114:1.6: “Mendicant, it’s when an educated noble disciple understands form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn22.114:1.10: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn22.114:1.12: And this is how a knowledgeable person is defined.”
